dt: {bc}to pass on (something, such as responsibility, rights, or powers) from one person or entity to another

dt.t: {it}devolving{/it} to western Europe full responsibility for its own defense
the estate {it}devolved{/it} on a distant cousin

dt: {bc}to fall or be passed usually as a responsibility or obligation

dt.t: the responsibility for breadwinning has {it}devolved{/it} increasingly upon women

dt: {bc}to come by or as if by flowing down

dt.t: his allegedly subversive campaigns … {wi}devolve{/wi} from his belief in basic American rights

dt: {bc}to {d_link|degenerate|degenerate:2} through a gradual change or evolution

et: Middle English {it}devolven{/it} "to transfer, overthrow," borrowed from Latin {it}dēvolvere{/it} "to roll (something) down, (in passive voice) sink or fall back, become subject (to), be passed down (to an heir)," from {it}dē-{/it} {et_link|de-|de-} + {it}volvere{/it} "to set in a circular course, cause to roll" {ma}{mat|wallow:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to pass on (something, such as responsibility, rights, or powers) from one person or entity to another
to pass by transmission or succession
to fall or be passed usually as a responsibility or obligation
